news_header: US President Donald Trump has signed a settlement with Meta, resulting in a $25 million payout related to the suspension of his social media accounts.
news_original_title: Meta to pay $25m to settle Trump lawsuit over ban
news_text: Donald Trump has reached a legal settlement with Meta, the owner of Facebook and Instagram, which will pay him approximately $25 million after his accounts were suspended following the Capitol riots on January 6, 2021. The settlement includes funds for Trump's presidential library and legal costs, but Meta will not admit to any wrongdoing. Trump's accounts were reinstated in July 2024, ahead of the presidential elections. Meanwhile, Meta is investing heavily in AI, defending its $65 billion investment amidst competition from Chinese AI developments.
